div.p: No. 53/57, p. number, unit 1, VPRS 3149 outward letter book, VA 856 Colonial Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 9.4.91. Corrected 7.9.92, 4.3.93. To proof.
See also H. Ginn to W. Lonsdale, 22 March 1853.
I do myself the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 22nd ultimo, requesting the authority of His Excellency to the payment of the usual forage allowance, for a second horse required for the Botanic Gardens, one being at present attached to the expedition to the Snowy Mountains, and the other being required for the use of the gardens.

In reply I am directed by the Lieutenant Governor to convey to you His Excellency's approval of the expenditure in question, and that the horse with Dr Mueller must be a charge upon the outfit of that Gentleman, as Government Botanist, of which the Auditor General has been duly apprized.
